entry.title: ROSEBURG SEES HEAVY RAIN SUNDAY, WATER YEAR ABOVE NORMAL
entry.summary: February 24, 2025 4:10 a.m. Roseburg saw a heavy amount of rainfall on Sunday but missed a record amount for the date. Forecasters at the National Weather Service told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Roseburg Regional Airport measured 0.93 inches of rain from 12:00 a.m. Sunday to 12:00 a.m. Monday. The...

entry.title: WIND ADVISORY 10:00 A.M. MONDAY THROUGH 1:00 A.M. AT TUESDAY
entry.summary: February 24, 2025 3:50 a.m. A Wind Advisory remains in effect from 10:00 a.m. Monday through 1:00 a.m. Tuesday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said strong winds of 20 to 30 miles per hour with gusts up to 45 miles per hour are expected. Stronger wind gusts are possible...

entry.title: TWO YEAR OREGON 42 PROJECTS BEGINS THIS WEEK
entry.summary: February 24, 2025 3:40 a.m. Work is beginning this week on a two-year Oregon Department of Transportation project on Oregon 42. An ODOT release said work will include paving the highway through Winston and the Green District, installing a traffic signal at Rolling Hills Road and adding several safety features and pedestrian improvements. Dan Latham...

entry.title: CITY COUNCIL WITH VARIED AGENDA FOR MONDAY NIGHT MEETING
entry.summary: February 24, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg City Council has a varied agenda for its meeting Monday night. Councilors will have the second reading of an ordinance amending the Roseburg Urban Growth Boundary, annexing property, amending the comprehensive plan map, amending the city zoning map and amending the Urban Growth Management Agreement. This is for...

entry.summary: February 24, 2025 3:20 a.m. In the KQEN Business Spotlight: Con-Vey has announced the promotion of Travis Pritchett to operations manager, effective February 1st. entry.title: LAW ENFORCEMENT K9 TEAMS HOLDING HOPS FOR COPS

entry.title: GOODS FROM THE WOODS TOUR/INTERNATIONAL DAY OF FORESTS
entry.summary: February 24, 2025 2:50 a.m. The OSU Extension Forestry and Natural Resources program and local partners will be holding a walking tour called “Goods from the Woods” on March 21st. An extension release said the event is a celebration of International Day of Forests and will provide attendees with an informative and relaxing walking tour...

entry.title: Roseburg Enjoys Warmest Day of 2025 So Far
entry.summary: Roseburg hit 65°F on February 22, making it the warmest day of 2025 so far. While warm, it didn’t break the 2002 record of 70°F. The record low for the date remains 28°F, set in 2019. Locals enjoyed the mild weather as spring approaches.

entry.summary: Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife staff will speak at a regular meeting for the Umpqua Fishermen's Association at 6 p.m. Tuesday.

entry.title: SEMI DRIVER HOSPITALIZED AFTER VEHICLE GOES OVER EMBANKMENT
entry.summary: February 21, 2025 2:45 p.m. A semi-driver was hospitalized after his vehicle crashed on Thursday evening. An Oregon State Police report said shortly after 5:00 p.m. troopers responded to the commercial motor vehicle accident on Highway 38 in the Scottsburg area, 14 miles east of Reedsport. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 2.21.25
entry.summary: In this two segment program, Umpqua Actor’s Community Theatre Executive Director Melanie Schwegel talks about their current production and their summer musical. Then Umpqua Valley Homebuilder’s Association Executive Officer Dana Lepre talks about next weekend’s Home and Garden Show at the fairgrounds.

entry.title: FILING PERIOD UNDERWAY FOR SPECIAL DISTRICTS ELECTION
entry.summary: February 21, 2025 3:50 a.m. The filing period is underway for the 2023 Special Districts Election. It will take place on May 20th with the deadline to file for candidacy set for March 20th. There are 223 positions open for filing in Douglas County. Elections for Special Districts in Oregon are held every two years,...

entry.title: APPLICATIONS BEING ACCEPTED FOR OPEN CITY COUNCIL POSITION
entry.summary: February 21, 2025 3:40 a.m. The City of Roseburg is accepting applications for an open seat on the city council. entry.title: DCSO AWARDED LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY ACCREDITATION
entry.summary: February 21, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office has officially received its voluntary law enforcement agency accreditation from the Northwest Accreditation Alliance. On Wednesday, during a ceremony at the Douglas County Board of Commissioners weekly meeting, Sheriff John Hanlin and Undersheriff Brad O’Dell were presented with the accreditation credentials by NWAA Executive Director...

entry.summary: February 21, 2025 2:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Roseburg Christian Academy is presenting “Cheaper by the Dozen” through Monday.
